title: Join Skroutz team
description:
Do you want to be part of an amazingly growing environment but you don’t see an opening matching your profile?

Worry not!!!
requirements:
Send us your CV telling us a few words about you, which team interests you and why you want to join Skroutz.

We will review your application and get back to you in the next two weeks.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Partners (BE 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

We are looking for Software Engineers with a strong technical background and a “get-things-done” attitude, who are eager to learn new exciting technologies to join our Partners team and help build a strong merchants value proposition with new products and services.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Improve our back-office system used by our 6000+ merchants.
  • Work on our Analytics platform which handles over 30 Million requests per day and its adjacent services.
  • Boost our Marketplace service offerings to further expand our e-commerce solution for brick-and-mortar shops.
  • Develop and maintain our in-house affiliate management system.
  • Enhance our billing algorithms, develop monitoring tools and build fraud detection mechanisms.
  • Improve our Merchants' support operations with new services and automated processes.
requirements:
What skills and experience you will need

  • High productivity on par with significant experience working as a Software Engineer in a professional setting.
  • A solid CS background.
  • Solid understanding of web architecture.
  • Strong knowledge of database systems (relational, document-based, etc).
  • Intrigued by the product as much as by the technology.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and team spirit.

We will appreciate if you have

  • Good knowledge of Ruby/Ruby on Rails is a huge plus.
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks/UI libraries (preferably React).
  • Familiarity with OOP principles and design patterns.
  • Comfort with TDD and other testing practices.
  • Exposure to architectural patterns and the production system of a large, performance-intensive web application.
  • Contributed to open-source projects

title: Reviews and Community Curator (RC 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

We are looking for a Reviews & Community Curator to help our users get the most out of the available public reviews, and ensure that the quality of the user-generated content (UGC) meets our users’ expectations.

As a Reviews & Community Curator, you’ll join our UGC team, responsible for driving customer engagement through our User Generated Content.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Ensuring that the daily thousands product reviews and user discussions are going to be published according to our terms and conditions.
  • Take appropriate action to inform our users about any necessary changes on their published content in a timely manner to meet or exceed their expectations.
  • Providing Skroutz’s users with the necessary information, support, and guidance for making the best use of our platform and its features, by interacting with them via various channels of communication -like emails, facebook messages, and inhouse tools.
  • Articulate technical issues, such as reproducing bugs and user remarks, to determine their accuracy, so that you could effectively relay to the rest of the team when needed.
  • Follow the team’s structure on monitoring, organising and analyzing users' feedback & go the extra mile to engage customers.
requirements:
• Excellent copywriting skills both in Greek and English.
  • Minimum 1 year in online customer support services (preferably in an eCommerce environment).
  • Outstanding communication skills with the ability to articulate technical issues (explore bugs), and active listening.
  • Detail and goal-oriented, creative individual with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize accordingly.
  • Fast-learner with empathy and positivity. Highly organized, and self-motivated worker with ability to take ownership of issues and follow through to resolution
  • Confident and outgoing personality with the ability to communicate effectively both in writing and verbally.
  • Team player, open-minded, enthusiastic and inspirational.

Nice to have skills

  • Community management in an eCommerce environment.
  • Forum moderator experience will be considered a plus.
  • Advanced Excel skills

title: Senior Product Manager (SPM 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

What We Are Looking For

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who can understand the needs of our users and simplify complex problems. Skroutz Product Teams build thoughtful e-commerce experiences through continuous experimentation and refinement. We want people with a collaborative mindset that can drive a cross-functional team to build the best possible experiences for our users.

A few examples of what you would do

  • Analyse performance of the checkout funnel, locate areas of improvement and drive incremental optimisations.
  • Understand company strategy and take part in quarterly planning in order to set goals and define success metrics.
  • Communicate with internal teams to coordinate the data entry, design and development of a new filter functionality that will help users locate a product among thousands of options.
  • Communicate and understand different approaches on the design of a new feature that exist between stakeholders. Use data and your business acumen to create alignment.
  • Help your team to integrate a new payment method to the checkout process. Communicate with 3rd party payment providers to evaluate offerings. Communicate with internal stakeholders to set requirements.
requirements:
What Skills and Experience You Will Need

  • At least 5 years of experience in a similar position.
  • Ability to collect and analyse data.
  • Great communication and organizational skills.
  • Great understanding of user interaction and experience.
  • Extended experience working closely with development and design teams.

We will Appreciate if you have

  • Good knowledge of Google Analytics and related software.
  • Working experience on e-commerce products.
  • Ability to understand technical challenges and adjust specifications.
  • Working experience in an multi-functional environment.

Please note that this opening concerns an onsite job, located in Athens, Attica, Greece.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer - Product (DN 1020)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by being incredibly trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

What We Are Looking For

We are looking to hire a talented UI / UX Designer, passionate about designing amazing yet simple user-centered experiences. You will be responsible for early-stage research and ideation, through implementation and iteration towards building products for the web, mobile web and apps.

What you are expected to do

  • Own all sides of design from concept to launch: storyboards, user flows, mockups, prototypes, and pixel perfect assets
  • Conduct user studies, competitive research and usability tests
  • Work closely with developers to see design through to implementation
  • Request early feedback through rapid prototypes or low fidelity wireframes
  • Develop, maintain and create pixel perfect designs, mockups and specifications as needed, adhering to brand guidelines
  • Maintain consistency in visual elements and ensure that our design system and philosophy is applied across the product
  • Collaborate with internal teams; communicate thoughts and expertise to the rest of the team
  • Stay on top of new technology and trends in mobile UI/UX designs
requirements:
Your Skills and Experience

  • Minimum 3 years experience in a relevant position
  • Excellent Portfolio of UI/UX design solutions across a spectrum of platforms and services
  • Experience of working in a cross-discipline team environment
  • Experience in user research, usability studies, personas
  • Degree in Digital or Graphic Design (optional)

Skills

  • Proficiency in relevant creative tools (Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma)
  • Familiarity with Abstract, Zeplin, Photoshop, Illustrator, prototyping tools
  • Demonstrated experience working with a design system, its curation, maintenance, and dissemination
  • Highly detail oriented with a drive for perfection down to the last pixel
  • Self-motivated to prioritise and manage workload and meet critical project deadlines
  • Positive attitude with a creative, solution-driven mindset
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS & Javascript (optional)

*Please make sure that you have included in your application a sample link of your UI/UX Portfolio. Applications with no portfolio will not be assessed further.

**Please note that this opening concerns an onsite job, located in Athens, Attica, Greece.

title: Backend Engineer - Product (BEP 1220)
description:
The Product team is responsible for shaping the product discovery experience for all users. We help users navigate and filter through millions of products in thousands of categories and assist them in figuring out how their specific needs will be met. To be successful, we have to translate the optimal user experience to a technological product, designing and implementing multiple experiments along the way. Our systems must be fast and reliable, often supporting more than 100k requests per minute.

We are looking for Software Engineers with a strong technical background and interest in building successful products and systems. You will be part of a small, talented and motivated team, tackle hard problems and improve the experience of millions of customers.

Examples of work you might undertake

  • Create the infrastructure to support the specific UX needs of each product category, whether it is fashion, home furniture or technology
  • Assist in the development of an excellent book shopping experience
  • Implement and maintain the best product reviewing system in the industry
  • Create or improve complex product filtering mechanisms such as sizes or colours
  • Run experiments and track several metrics to measure success
  • Maintain a software stack that serves millions of requests per day
requirements:
Your skills and experience

  • Solid algorithmic and software engineering background
  • Solid understanding of web architecture
  • Very good knowledge of at least one programming language. We work mostly in Ruby, but we believe that languages can be learned; we care much more about your general engineering skills
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of SQL and database systems
  • Passion for readable, maintainable, testable, scalable and performant code
  • Ability to navigate around a relatively large existing codebase and cooperatively improve it through code reviews
  • Experience with a version control system (preferably Git) and a CI workflow
  • Team spirit and easy going attitude
